column4: hi, I've upgraded to 8.04 yesterday and I have a question, why does nautilus call all my partitions "Media of XXGB" thought they're mounted on specific places by me (/etc/fstab) ?
that's just the new behaviour in gnome now =(
is there a work-around, like a label or something ?
I've just put up with it - Thankfully all my volumes are different sizes but I'll have a look
I'm going to search the ubuntuforums and soem GNOME docs, perhaps I can find a way
if you do find a way, please drop me a PM =)
okay I've got something... apparently things need proper labels now - mountpoints won't do
run "sudo blkid" to see if your drives have labels, if they don't, read: http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=4835670&postcount=17
okey great, thanks :D
or just go to computer:/// in nautilus, right click each volume and go to properties and rename it
that last idea is better I guess, especially for new users
*grumbles* that doesn't appear to be implemented yet though for some unknown reason
apparently: they don't have a backend or something
indeed.. I'm trying it as root
Nope.. no love there

lol :p
e2label looks like it's working... I'll need to restart before I know for sure
